title: About
text: Curious and passionate quantitative researcher with analytical thinking and project management skills.

title: About
text:
Scope

Data management and cleaning
Data analysis
Data visualisation as an advocacy tool
Capacity building, outreach and data literacy

I also like to paint horrible water-colour doodles, snorkel and dive, fail while trying to learn more stuff and to airdrum ü§ü

Pelagic stingray encounter!

title: Shira Salingre
text:
My mission is to make complicated ideas clear and easy to understand. My work is dedicated to creating meaningful information from data and to make knowledge accessible to everyone. I do this with data analysis and visualisation, as well as through creating educational materials on marine ecology topics (and others!).
I am based in Barcelona but I work everywhere.
Feel free to contact me.
Email: shira.salin@outlook.com

title: Shira Salingre
text:
Song of the Sea (Self employed) | 2015 - Present
Professional adviser and project coordinator for a multitude of projects, mainly focusing on creating educational and professional materials on marine ecology and conservation.
Example: NPA (Nature and Parks Authority) posters for the general public on marine fauna, in Hebrew
Data analyst in various ecological research projects.



HaMaarag - Israel‚Äôs Nature Assessment Program | 2020 - 2022
Ecological data processing, analysis, visualisation and reporting for the nonprofit organisation Hamaarag. Worked as part of the team of the State of Nature Report 2022, and other projects.



Ruppin Academic Center | 2019 - 2022
Teaching undergraduate students in an intensive week-long course on the ecology of the Mediterranean.



The Belmaker lab, Tel Aviv University | 2018-2020
Explored how co-occurrence of fish species in the Mediterranean sea changes along environmental gradients. My whole work was based on using models in R environment.
My dataset: MEData



Nature and Parks Authority | 2007-2019
Guided tours that were nature conservation orientated, in field trips and in class or lectures. Lead long-term ecological and environmental educational projects.



Sharks in Israel | 2014-2019
Established and managed a shark and rays citizen science observation database. Co-founder of the organisation ‚ÄúSharks in Israel‚Äù.



Nature and Parks Authority & Tel Aviv University | 2016-2018
Collected data from recreational fishermen on their fishing habits and catch to create first-ever quantitative estimates on recreational fishing extent in Israel.



Gitai Yahel‚Äôs lab, Ruppin Academic Center | 2016-2018
Worked on various ecological project as part of the Ruppin Estuarine Coastal Observatory (RECO). Here I took samples from the estuary, extracted biological and chemical information from them and assisted with other projects on marine ascidians.



The National Sea Turtle Rescue Center, NPA | 2011 and 2017
Coordinated and managed a team of volunteers of the Sharon region hatchery, throughout the hatching season. As part of my work I also had to update and consult the hatching database for our operations.



The National Sea Turtle Rescue Center, NPA | 2009-2016
Cleaned and fed turtles and helped when needed in medical operations. It was great fun!



Earthcare St.¬†Kilda, Melbourne, Australia | 2013
A one off volunteer experience I had while living and working in Melbourne, Australia. We were physically removing northern pacific seastar from Port Phillip bay.



Eye of the Whale, Alaska, USA | 2011
While traveling in Alaska I took part in this unique research where we recorded humpback whales in the bay of Homer, and identified the individuals. It was an amazing experiance I will never forget.

title: Shira Salingre - Resume
section: MSc Marine Ecology | Tel Aviv University
text:
MSc Marine Ecology | Tel Aviv University
Belmaker lab for Marine Ecology and Biodiversity, School of Zoology
Graduated in December 2020.
Where I learned and practiced most of my data science skills, mainly using R, Rstudio (now ‚Äòposit‚Äô) and GitHub. I also started a Github account for our lab, initiated a Google website platform for our fish identification guide (which we all built together), gathered and cleaned our Mediterranean database and lead lab hackathons.
Research topic: Dynamic fish networks along environmental gradients in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Shira Salingre - Resume
section: BSc Marine Sciences | Ruppin Academic Center
text:
BSc Marine Sciences | Ruppin Academic Center
Graduated 2017 with distinction.
Had the opportunity to learn from doing as this was a very hands-on track. I learned basics of research methods, including data analysis using GIS software and Microsoft Excel. My studies included an active research project on the effects of fish farms in open seas.

title: Shira Salingre
text:
Education




 
  
    Degree 
    Year 
    Institution 
  
 

  
    Master of Science (Ecology) 
    2018-2020 
    Tel Aviv University 
  
  
    Bachelor of Science (Marine Sciences) 
    2014-2017 
    Ruppin Academic Center 
  





In my BSc I learned basics of research methods, including data analysis using GIS software and Microsoft Excel. My studies included a research project on the effects of fish farms in open seas.
During my Master studies I learned and practiced most of my data science skills, mainly using R, Rstudio (now ‚Äòposit‚Äô) and GitHub.
I also started a Github account for our lab, initiated a Google website platform for our fish identification guide (which we all built together), gathered and cleaned our Mediterranean database and lead lab hackathons.
My research topic was ‚ÄúDynamic fish networks along environmental gradients in the Mediterranean Sea‚Äù.

title: About
text:
Who am I?
My professional background comes from nature sciences. I studied marine biology and ecology in my undergraduate (BSc) and specialised in fish community ecology in my masters (MSc).
During my bachelor‚Äôs degree I was exposed and started to engage with the world of data and became fascinated about it. At the time I had the opportunity to establish, maintain and analyse a sharks and rays observation database, and to set up a protocol for observations data collection and management, which is still in use by teams of marine biologists all around the Mediterranean.
My two-year long master‚Äôs was a great mix of survey dives (for other people‚Äôs research) and data processing and analysis (for my research).
Just before finishing my degree, I started working in an organisation that its main mission is to report the state of nature in Israel, and this is where I spent many days, months and, overall, about two years of data crunching, exploration and analysis to create insights on the processes that nature in Israel had gone through in the past 10-30 years. I worked with tabular data and with geographical data (combining R with QGIS and ArcGIS).
I was also doing freelance work as an ecology specialist and data analyst for several clients including organisations, researchers, and councils.
